# Planning Document Templates

Standard templates for all seven Crucible planning documents.

---

## 1. Crucible Thesis Template

```markdown
# Crucible Thesis: [BOOK TITLE]

## The Burden (Quest Strand Core)
**Type:** [Object/Person/Knowledge/Mission/Role]
**Description:** [What must be carried/achieved/protected/destroyed]
**Origin:** [How protagonist receives it]
**Stakes:** [What happens if failed]

## The Fire (Fire Strand Core)
**Type:** [Power/Curse/Transformation/Knowledge/Connection]
**Description:** [What the internal force is]
**Manifestation:** [How it appears]
**Danger:** [What happens without mastery]
**Cost:** [Ongoing price of use]

## Core Constellation Bond
**Type:** [Romantic/Familial/Friendship/Mentor/Alliance]
**With Whom:** [Character name]
**Why Unbreakable:** [What makes this bond the anchor]
**How Tested:** [What threatens to break it]

## Dark Mirror Connection
**Parallel:** [What protagonist and antagonist share]
**Divergence:** [Where their paths split]
**Antagonist's Truth:** [The genuine insight in their philosophy]

## The Forging Question
**Must Become:** [What protagonist must transform into]
**Starting Point:** [Who they are at beginning]
**The Change:** [What transformation occurs]

## The Surrender (Apex)
**What is Given Up:** [The essential thing]
**Why Willing:** [What makes it a choice, not a loss]
**What Enables:** [How surrender creates victory]

## Theme
**Statement:** [The moral argument in one sentence]
**How Proven:** [Through what events/choices]
**What Antagonist Represents:** [The counter-argument]

## Blade's Purpose (After Forging)
**What Protagonist Becomes:** [Their role after transformation]
**The Gift:** [How the wound becomes useful]
**New Status:** [Their relationship to the world]

---

## Quick Reference
- **Burden:** [One line]
- **Fire:** [One line]
- **Bond:** [One line]
- **Mirror:** [One line]
- **Become:** [One line]
- **Surrender:** [One line]
- **Theme:** [One line]
- **Blade:** [One line]
```

---

## 2. Strand Map Templates

### Quest Strand Map

```markdown
# Quest Strand Map: [BOOK TITLE]

## The Burden
**What It Is:** [Description]
**Physical Form:** [If applicable]
**Why It Matters:** [Stakes]

## Origin of the Burden
**How Received:** [Inherited/Discovered/Thrust upon/Chosen/Stolen]
**The Moment:** [Specific scene/event]
**Initial Understanding:** [What protagonist thinks it means]

## Why This Protagonist
**The Qualification:** [Why only they can carry this]
**The Irony:** [Why they're also the worst choice]

## Antagonist's Stake
**Why They Oppose:** [Their motivation]
**What They Want:** [With the burden]
**Personal Connection:** [To protagonist, if any]

## Quest Escalation
| Stage | Scope | Stakes |
|-------|-------|--------|
| Personal | [Initial scope] | [Personal stakes] |
| Community | [Expanded scope] | [Community stakes] |
| World | [Final scope] | [World stakes] |

## The Impossible Requirement
**What Makes It Impossible:** [The obstacle]
**Why Previous Attempts Failed:** [History]
**What Will Be Different:** [How protagonist succeeds]

## Resolution
**How Burden Ends:** [Destroyed/Transformed/Passed/Returned/Merged/Sealed]
**The Method:** [Specific action]
**The Cost:** [What resolution requires]

## Beat Placement
| Beat | Quest Element |
|------|--------------|
| 2 | Catalyst arrives |
| 4 | Burden accepted |
| 9 | First test |
| 16 | Parallel quests |
| 19 | Institution corrupted |
| 22 | Thread returns |
| 24 | Gathering storm |
| 29 | War of all fronts |
| 31 | Mercies pay off |
| 34 | Burden's end |
```

### Fire Strand Map

```markdown
# Fire Strand Map: [BOOK TITLE]

## The Fire
**Nature:** [Magic/Curse/Transformation/Knowledge/Connection]
**Physical Manifestation:** [How it appears]
**Source:** [Where it comes from]

## Awakening
**How It First Manifests:** [Explosive/Gradual/Triggered/Suppressed/Inherited]
**The Moment:** [Specific scene]
**Protagonist's Reaction:** [Terror/Wonder/Denial/etc.]

## The Danger
**Without Mastery:** [Madness/Transformation/Harm to others/Becoming antagonist/Death]
**Signs of Deterioration:** [How danger manifests progressively]
**Point of No Return:** [What would make it irreversible]

## Cost of Use
**Immediate Cost:** [Physical/Emotional/Other]
**Cumulative Cost:** [Long-term effect]
**Hidden Cost:** [What protagonist doesn't realize]

## Mastery Path
**What Mastery Requires:** [Acceptance/Bond/Surrender/Integration/Sacrifice]
**Why It's Difficult:** [The obstacle to mastery]
**The Key Insight:** [What protagonist must understand]

## Hardening Phase (Movement III)
**The Line Crossed:** [What ruthless act]
**Why Necessary:** [The justification]
**The Cost:** [What it costs humanity-wise]

## Mastery Moment (Beat 23)
**How Achieved:** [Near-death/Guidance/Protection/Understanding/Acceptance]
**The Transformation:** [What changes]
**What's Different After:** [New relationship with Fire]

## Beat Placement
| Beat | Fire Element |
|------|-------------|
| 2 | Catalyst/revelation |
| 3 | First spark |
| 7 | Wandering flame |
| 8 | Rival flame |
| 14 | Dark mirror shown |
| 17 | Hardening begins |
| 23 | Fire mastered |
| 26 | Dark mirror's offer |
| 32 | Confrontation beyond |
| 33 | Willed surrender |
```

### Constellation Strand Map

```markdown
# Constellation Strand Map: [BOOK TITLE]

## Core Constellation
**The Unbreakable Bond:** [Relationship type and with whom]
**The Faithful Companion:** [Who]
**The Sacrifice Character:** [Who will die]
**The Betrayer/Apparent Betrayer:** [Who]

## The Faithful Companion
**Who:** [Name]
**Why Faithful:** [What binds them]
**Their Arc:** [How they change]
**Key Moments:** [Important scenes]

## The Sacrifice (Beat 25)
**Who:** [Name]
**Why Them:** [Why their death is necessary/meaningful]
**The Heroic Choice:** [What they choose]
**What It Teaches Protagonist:** [About surrender]

## The Betrayal/Apparent Betrayal
**Who:** [Name]
**What It Looks Like:** [The betrayal]
**The Truth:** [Real or apparent? If apparent, the reality]
**Resolution:** [How it resolves]

## Constellation Expansion (Movement III)
**New Allies:** [Who joins]
**How Fellowship Becomes Movement:** [The expansion]
**Tensions Introduced:** [New conflicts]

## The Bond That Holds (Beat 27)
**The Test:** [What threatens to break core bond]
**Why It Holds:** [What proves it unbreakable]
**The Moment:** [Specific scene]

## Constellation's Fate (Coda)
**Who Survives:** [List]
**Who Doesn't:** [List]
**Final State:** [How relationships end]

## Beat Placement
| Beat | Constellation Element |
|------|----------------------|
| 1 | Unlit forge (community) |
| 5 | First constellation |
| 8 | Rival (comparison) |
| 10 | Constellation strained |
| 13 | Sanctuary (teaching) |
| 15 | Constellation expands |
| 18 | Beloved endangered |
| 20 | Mercy that costs |
| 25 | Constellation's sacrifice |
| 27 | Bond that holds |
| 35 | Cost revealed |
```

---

## 3. Forge Point Blueprint Template

```markdown
# Forge Point Blueprint: [FP NAME]

## Overview
**Forge Point:** [0/1/2/3/Apex]
**Location:** [Movement, approximate percentage]
**Purpose:** [What this forge point accomplishes]

## The Three Crises

### Quest Crisis
**The Problem:** [What threatens the external quest]
**Why It Can't Be Ignored:** [Stakes/urgency]
**What Resolution Requires:** [Action needed]

### Fire Crisis
**The Problem:** [What threatens internally]
**Why It Can't Be Ignored:** [Stakes/danger]
**What Resolution Requires:** [Action needed]

### Constellation Crisis
**The Problem:** [What threatens relationships]
**Why It Can't Be Ignored:** [Stakes/bonds at risk]
**What Resolution Requires:** [Action needed]

## The Convergence
**What Single Event Triggers All Three:** [The convergent moment]
**Why They Can't Be Resolved Separately:** [The binding]
**The Impossible Choice:** [What protagonist faces]

## The Sacrifice
**Which Strand is Sacrificed:** [Quest/Fire/Constellation]
**What Specifically is Lost:** [The loss]
**Why This Strand:** [Why this one, not others]
**How It's Lost:** [The specific moment/action]

## The Aftermath
**State Before:** [Situation going in]
**State After:** [Situation coming out]
**Why No Return:** [What makes this irreversible]
**What Protagonist Learns:** [The lesson]

## Forward Momentum
**Into Next Movement:** [How this propels forward]
**New Status Quo:** [What's different now]
**What's at Stake Next:** [Rising stakes]
```

---

## 4. Dark Mirror Profile Template

```markdown
# Dark Mirror Profile: [ANTAGONIST NAME]

## Identity
**Name:** [Full name]
**Role:** [Their position/power]
**Appearance:** [Physical description]

## The Parallel
**What They Share with Protagonist:**
- [Shared element 1]
- [Shared element 2]
- [Shared element 3]

**The Connection:** [How/why they're linked]

## The Divergence
**The Moment:** [When paths split]
**Protagonist Chose:** [Their choice]
**Antagonist Chose:** [Their choice]
**Why Each Choice Made Sense:** [Both perspectives]

## Philosophy
**What They Believe:** [Core worldview]
**The Genuine Truth:** [What's right about it]
**The Fatal Flaw:** [What leads to destruction]
**Why Compelling:** [Why readers might agree]

## Their Want
**What They're Fighting For:** [Their goal]
**Why They Think They're Right:** [Their justification]
**What They're Willing to Sacrifice:** [Their cost acceptance]

## The Offer (Beat 26)
**What They Propose:** [The alternative]
**Real Benefits:** [Why it's tempting]
**Hidden Cost:** [What accepting would mean]
**Why Protagonist Might Accept:** [The temptation]

## Their Defeat
**Method:** [How they're defeated]
**How Protagonist's Choices Enable This:** [Connection to mercy, etc.]
**What Makes It Earned:** [Why this works]

## Their End
**Fate:** [Death/Redemption/Imprisonment/Escape/Transcendence/Mercy]
**Final Moment:** [The last scene]
**Thematic Meaning:** [What this says about the story]

## Key Scenes
| Beat | Scene |
|------|-------|
| 14 | Dark Mirror shown |
| 26 | Dark Mirror's offer |
| 32 | Confrontation beyond |
| [X] | [Resolution] |
```

---

## 5. Constellation Bible Template

```markdown
# Constellation Bible: [BOOK TITLE]

## Protagonist: [NAME]

### Identity
**Full Name:** [Name]
**Age:** [Age]
**Physical:** [Description]
**Background:** [Origin/history]

### The Unlit State (Before Ignition)
**Life Situation:** [Restless/Content/Wounded/Ambitious]
**What's Missing:** [What they need]

### The Wound
**What Haunts Them:** [Pre-story trauma]
**How It Manifests:** [Behaviors/fears]
**How It's Healed:** [If at all]

### The Lie
**What They Believe:** [False belief about self]
**Where It Came From:** [Origin]
**When Shattered:** [The moment of truth]

### Arc
**Starts As:** [Beginning state]
**Becomes:** [End state]
**Key Change Points:** [When/how they change]

---

## [CHARACTER NAME]: [ROLE]

### Identity
**Relationship to Protagonist:** [Bond type]
**First Appearance:** [When/how]
**Key Function:** [What they provide]

### Character
**Personality:** [Traits]
**Want:** [What they desire]
**Fear:** [What they avoid]

### Arc
**Start:** [Initial state]
**Change:** [How they develop]
**End:** [Final state]

### Key Scenes
- Chapter [X]: [Scene description]
- Chapter [Y]: [Scene description]

---

[Repeat for each significant character]

---

## Relationship Web

```
                    [PROTAGONIST]
                    /    |    \
                   /     |     \
    [Companion]        [Bond]        [Mentor]
           \           |           /
            \          |          /
             [Other relationships]
```

## Relationship Arcs

### [Protagonist] â†” [Character]
**Start:** [Initial dynamic]
**Middle:** [How it changes]
**Crisis:** [When tested]
**Resolution:** [Final state]
```

## 6. Mercy Ledger Template

```markdown
# Mercy Ledger: [BOOK TITLE]

## Mercy 1: The Seed

**Movement:** II
**Chapter:** [X]

### The Recipient
**Who:** [Name/description]
**Their Crime:** [What they did/are]
**Why Dangerous:** [Risk of mercy]

### The Act
**What Protagonist Does:** [The merciful action]
**When/Where:** [Context]

### Immediate Cost
**What It Costs:** [Time/Resources/Strategic/etc.]
**Strand Threatened:** [Quest/Fire/Constellation]
**Companion Reaction:** [How allies respond]

### Later Payoff
**What Recipient Does:** [Their action]
**When:** Movement IV, Chapter [X]
**How It Helps:** [Contribution to victory]

---

## Mercy 2: The Investment

**Movement:** III
**Chapter:** [X]

### The Recipient
**Who:** [Name/description]
**Their Crime:** [What they did/are]
**Why Dangerous:** [Risk of mercy]

### The Act
**What Protagonist Does:** [The merciful action]
**When/Where:** [Context]

### Immediate Cost
**What It Costs:** [Strategic disadvantage]
**Strand Threatened:** [Quest/Fire/Constellation]
**Companion Reaction:** [How allies respond]

### Later Payoff
**What Recipient Does:** [Their action]
**When:** Movement V, Chapter [X]
**How It Helps:** [Contribution to victory]

---

## Mercy 3: The Risk

**Movement:** IV
**Chapter:** [X]

### The Recipient
**Who:** [Name/description]
**Their Crime:** [What they did/are]
**Why Dangerous:** [Risk of mercy]

### The Act
**What Protagonist Does:** [The merciful action]
**When/Where:** [Context]

### Immediate Cost
**What It Costs:** [Companion endangered]
**Strand Threatened:** [Quest/Fire/Constellation]
**Companion Reaction:** [How allies respond]

### Later Payoff
**What Recipient Does:** [Their action]
**When:** Movement V, Chapter [X]
**How It Helps:** [Contribution to victory]

---

## Mercy 4: The Impossible Gift

**Movement:** V
**Chapter:** [X]

### The Recipient
**Who:** [Name/description]
**Their Crime:** [What they did/are]
**Why They Don't Deserve It:** [The impossible aspect]

### The Act
**What Protagonist Does:** [The merciful action]
**When/Where:** [Context]

### Immediate Cost
**What It Costs:** [Appears to guarantee failure]
**Strand Threatened:** [Quest/Fire/Constellation]
**Why It Seems Foolish:** [The risk]

### Later Payoff (Beat 31)
**How This Enables Unexpected Agents:** [The connection]
**What Recipient Does:** [Their action]
**How Victory Comes Through Mercy:** [The mechanism]

| Mercy | Movement | Recipient | Act | Cost | Payoff |
```

## 7. World Forge Template

```markdown
# World Forge: [BOOK TITLE]

## The World's Wound
**Cosmic Problem:** [What's wrong with the world]
**Origin:** [How it began]
**Current State:** [How it manifests now]
**Connection to Quest:** [How burden relates]

## Power System

### Source
**Type:** [Bloodline/External/Learned/Divine/Natural/Technological]
**Origin:** [Where power comes from]
**Who Can Access:** [Limitations on users]

### Mechanics
**How It Works:** [Basic function]
**Visible Signs:** [What use looks like]
**Training Method:** [How learned/developed]

### Limitations
**Physical Cost:** [Exhaustion/pain]
**Scarcity:** [Limited uses/sources]
**Specificity:** [Narrow applications]
**Corruption Risk:** [Danger of overuse]
**Required Conditions:** [What's needed]

### Previous Wielders
**History:** [Past users]
**Their Fate:** [What happened to them]
**What Protagonist Learns from Them:** [Lessons]

## Geography

### Key Locations

**[Location 1]: The Ordinary World**
- Description: [Physical details]
- Significance: [Story role]
- When Featured: [Chapters]

**[Location 2]: The Threshold**
- Description: [Physical details]
- Significance: [Story role]
- When Featured: [Chapters]

**[Location 3]: The Sanctuary**
- Description: [Physical details]
- Significance: [Story role]
- When Featured: [Chapters]

**[Location 4]: The Corrupted Institution**
- Description: [Physical details]
- Significance: [Story role]
- When Featured: [Chapters]

**[Location 5]: The Dark Heart**
- Description: [Physical details]
- Significance: [Story role]
- When Featured: [Chapters]

## World-Protagonist Mirror
**How World Reflects Protagonist:** [The connection]
**Examples:** 
- [How world changes with protagonist]
- [How emotions affect environment]

## Cultures
**Number of Cultures:** [How many relevant]
**Main Culture:** [Description]
**Other Cultures:** [Descriptions]
**Conflicts:** [Tensions between them]

## History
**Relevant Past:** [What matters from history]
**Connection to Present:** [How it affects now]
**What Protagonist Discovers:** [Historical revelations]

## Timeline
**Story Duration:** [How long story spans]
**Key Time Markers:** [Seasons, events, etc.]
**Time Pressure:** [Any deadlines]

## Rules/Consistency Notes
- [Rule 1 - cannot be broken]
- [Rule 2 - cannot be broken]
- [Rule 3 - cannot be broken]
```
